result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevor J Hovde

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:18 AM Defendant Trevor J Hovde in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Trevor J Hovde.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing, filed by Attorney Kershek.
Filed by Atty. Kershek.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:34 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Trevor J Hovde in court. Attorney Mark Emil Kershek not in court. 

The Court notes that attorney Kershek was just appointed. 
The Court conducts a colloquy as it relates to prelim time limits with the Defendant.
The Defendant requests a prelim within 20 days.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Appointing Attorney Mark Kershek
Hearing on October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing November 1, 2022. (BC)

10:00 AM Defendant Trevor J Hovde in court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing November 1, 2022.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. Court sets matter for status of counsel.   Defendant to report to the business center after court today.
Hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Letter filed by Defendant requesting adjournment**Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 10/4 "Denied. Matter is status on prelim. for scheduling. Defendant to be in court in person."
Filed by the defendant
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Paul F. Reilly on 9/26/22.
Hearing on October 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

2:23 PM Defendant Trevor J Hovde in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula, as a friend of the court.  
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Court advises of right to an attorney. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
WCS Pre-trial Report
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
